Over the course of seven exciting days, you’ll explore three beautiful regions, covering over 150 kilometers on your eBike. Ride along the Coast to Vines trail, into the famous McLaren Vale wine region, home to the iconic d'Arenberg Cube and the rolling hills of the Mt Lofty Ranges. Head into the Adelaide Hills for a day dedicated to exclusive wine tastings at renowned producers like Beerenberg, Udder delights, Shaw & Smith, and The Lane Winery. Next your journey will continue to the Barossa Valley, a highlight of Australian wine regions. Here, you’ll spend two full days exploring this historic area where you'll visit culinary legends like Maggie Beer, Seppeltsfield, and Yalumba. Relax and enjoy every moment of this incredible experience, knowing your journey is in expert hands. This tour is Easy to Moderate with some off road trails. View more View less 6 nights + guided cycling tour + sightseeing from $ 2409 per person share twin. Flights additional Enquire now Sale Period : Until 23 Jan 26 or unless sold out prior Your inclusions 6 Nights accommodation across Adelaide 5 Days Cycling (4 Days Guided) A fully guided Food & Wine experience in Hahndorf Daily luggage and personal transfers Experienced Guide MTB or E-Hybrid Bike hire with panniers and lights for 5 days All Park Fees Meals are excluded (Except for lunch on Day 3). Price from From $2409 per person share twin From $3199 per solo traveller 25/26 Sunday Departures: 07 Dec 25, 15 Feb 26 & 1 Mar 26 From $2869 per person share twin From $3789 per solo traveller 26/27 Sunday Departures: 27 Sep 26, 11 Oct 26, 25 Oct 26, 08 Nov 26, 22 Nov 26, 06 Dec 26, 31 Jan 27, 14 Feb 27, 28 Feb 27, 14 Mar 27, 04 Apr 27, 18 Apr 27, 02 May 27 & 16 May 27 7 Day Guided Cycling Tour - Intinerary Day 1 : Arrive to Adelaide Arrive in to Adelaide, make your way to your accommodation at your leisure. Transfers from airport are not included. Accommodation: Ibis Adelaide Day 2: Marino Rocks to McLaren Vale Begin with an 8am pickup from your city accommodation. After reaching Marino Rocks, you'll be equipped with an electric bike and embark on a short ride to a cafe for coffee and a tour briefing. The scenic ride along the Coast to Vines Rail Trail to McLaren Vale will treat you to coastal views and numerous wineries to explore, your luggage will be transferred to your McLaren Vale accommodation, allowing you to savor the McLaren Vale wine region at your own pace. Arrive at McLaren Vale approx. 12.30pm, where you can spend the afternoon exploring the Vales and its surroundings. Accommodation: Serafino in McLaren Vale Ride distance: 33km (Guided) Day 3: Hahndorf Gourmet Food & Wine Tour Meet at 8am, and transfer to Hahndorf for a guided tour through the charming Main Street. At 10am, a delectable cheese platter and freshly baked bread await you at Udder Delights. Experience the exquisite Wine Flight at Shaw & Smith at 11am. At 12:30 pm, embark on a beautiful ride between The Lane Winery and Shaw & Smith. Enjoy a picnic basket with a bottle of Lois Sparkling Wine at one of their panoramic picnic spots. After your picnic, take a self-guided journey through the country lanes to visit Beerenberg Farm at 2pm (strawberry picking available during the season). Picnics are available from October to April; during May to September, you'll enjoy a lunch experience at Beerenberg instead. Accommodation: The Manna Hahndorf Ride distance: 23km (Guided) Day 4: Oakbank to Barossa Valley At 8:30 am, transfer to Oakbank to begin cycling through the heart of the Adelaide Hills along the Amy Gillett Rail Trail to Mt. Torrens, taking in the breathtaking countryside. Bikes will be loaded at Mt. Torrens, and you'll transfer to Sandy Creek, where you'll continue your journey on bikes, enjoying the Barossa Rail Trail. Reach Lyndoch for lunch and then proceed to Tanunda. Accommodation: The Barossa Weintal Ride distance: 38km (Guided + Support bus provided) Day 5: Barossa Valley by Bike (Self-guided) Today, you have the freedom to explore the Barossa Valley on your own. Cycle through Jacobs Creek Winery to Tanunda, Nuriootpa, and Angaston, where you can taste world-famous wines and witness breathtaking sights. Alternatively, venture off the trail to visit historic Seppeltsfield, Yalumba, and Maggie Beer while in the area. Accommodation: The Barossa Weintal Ride distance: At your leisure (Self-Guided) Day 6: Hills to Sea (Glenelg) - River Torrens Linea Pk At 8am, bikes will be loaded and transferred with you to the foothills in Athelstone, the beginning of the River Torrens Linea Pk. Follow the river downstream through the city to reach the beach at Glenelg, enjoying a memorable ride. Arrive Glenelg at approx. 12.30pm, time to relax and savor the beach. Accommodation: Stamford Grand Glenelg Ride distance: 35km (Guided) Day 7: Adelaide Farewell Say farewell to the group.
